metadata.synopsis: Barcus has agreed to rest in your camp. This will be his base of operations for looking for Wulbren.
metadata.how_to_trigger: loadlevel WLD_Main_Ateleport S_FOR_UnfortunateGnomekill the goblins and free the gnome talk to the gnome and ask nothing in return for saving himoe CAMP_MoveGnomeToCamp

8.speaker: Barcus Wroot
8.text: Thank you for agreeing to find Wulbren. It means a great deal to me, indeed.

33.speaker: Barcus Wroot
33.text: I'll soon be off to gather your compensation. With your track record, I'm sure you'll find Wulbren in no time - so I'll be quick!

35.speaker: Barcus Wroot
35.text: If anything's happened to Wulbren, someone is going to be very sorry. I'll make sure of that.

76.speaker: Barcus Wroot
76.text: I thank you for the invitation to your camp. It's well-appointed. Not too crowded.

30.speaker: Barcus Wroot
30.text: Perfect for thinking, and I've been doing just that.

14.speaker: Barcus Wroot
14.text: It's about Wulbren. We know he's been taken to Moonrise Towers. And we know I'm going to save him.

72.speaker: Barcus Wroot
72.text: The problem is this: a preponderance of evidence that I am a terrible adventurer.

118.speaker: Barcus Wroot
118.text: I'm not sure I should trust Wulbren's fate to, well, me.

75.speaker: Player
75.text: I'm destined for Moonrise Towers. I could look for him.

19.speaker: Player
19.text: If I've ever to visit Moonrise Towers, I could look for him.

112.speaker: Barcus Wroot
112.text: Hmm. You've done so much already. I'm hesitant to prevail upon you again, but...

9.speaker: Barcus Wroot
9.text: I can't risk re-capture. I barely escaped last time.

66.speaker: Barcus Wroot
66.text: You'd do it, then? You'd look for him?

50.speaker: Player
50.text: I'll let you know if I hear anything - no more, no less.

53.speaker: Barcus Wroot
53.text: That's... very decent of you. Thank you.

62.speaker: Barcus Wroot
62.text: There's something else you should know. Something I can no longer ignore.

46.speaker: Barcus Wroot
46.text: I know you've learned about the gnomes' pursuit of runepowder. But do you know what it truly is?

117.speaker: Player
117.text: Other than a valuable explosive? Perhaps not.

114.speaker: Player
114.text: I have the feeling you're about to tell me.

65.speaker: Barcus Wroot
65.text: Until very recently, I thought runepowder was a myth. A substance so powerful it could fell a city - a nation.

5.speaker: Barcus Wroot
5.text: The Ironhand Gnomes have proven the impossible. Runepowder is real. And they have it in their possession.

57.speaker: Player
57.text: What do they want to do with it?

99.speaker: Barcus Wroot
99.text: Destruction. The only thing it's good for. But destruction of what - well, I'm hoping Wulbren will be able to tell us.

123.speaker: Barcus Wroot
123.text: I shouldn't have let him drift away. Shouldn't have let that lot get their claws into him.

82.speaker: Barcus Wroot
82.text: Now, more than ever, I need to find him. We need to find him. He's the only one I might be able to speak to sensibly.

128.speaker: Player
128.text: I'll find your friend - and together, we'll stop the Ironhand Gnomes.

23.speaker: Barcus Wroot
23.text: I'd kiss you, but neither of us deserves that.

10.speaker: Player
10.text: We can't count on Wulbren surviving the Towers. We should go after the gnomes en route to Baldur's Gate.

43.speaker: Barcus Wroot
43.text: No matter what he's done, I can't abandon Wulbren. You understand.

106.speaker: Player
106.text: Yes, I do. Some people are worth it.

92.speaker: Barcus Wroot
92.text: Perhaps that's why you've agreed to look for him. I'm lucky - and grateful.

52.speaker: Barcus Wroot
52.text: Pity. Everyone deserves a friend. Even me, apparently.

39.speaker: Barcus Wroot
39.text: Honestly, I can't even remember the last time we spoke.

109.speaker: Barcus Wroot
109.text: Still, some bonds are simply unbreakable. Neither axe nor the ticking bomb of time can sever them.

54.speaker: Player
54.text: I don't work for free. Make me an offer.

51.speaker: Barcus Wroot
51.text: Find Wulbren, and you can have anything it is within my power to give.

113.speaker: Player
113.text: I'll take some more of those smokepowder bombs.

6.speaker: Barcus Wroot
6.text: Now we're talking! I can whip some up for you, no problem - but I'll need a little time to gather the right supplies.

13.speaker: Barcus Wroot
13.text: Oh, this is excellent - I'll get started right away!

95.speaker: Player
95.text: There's something else I'd like to discuss.

60.speaker: Barcus Wroot
60.text: I... haven't that much on me, I'm afraid. But I'll tell you what: you find Wulbren, and I'll return with exactly that sum.

24.speaker: Barcus Wroot
24.text: A very fair trade, I think!

121.speaker: Player
121.text: Surprise me - but make it good.

64.speaker: Barcus Wroot
64.text: Aha! I know just the thing. You find Wulbren, and I'll gather the necessary implements.

88.speaker: Barcus Wroot
88.text: Trust me - you won't be disappointed.

55.speaker: Player
55.text: What can you tell me about Moonrise Towers?

16.speaker: Barcus Wroot
16.text: I haven't been there myself. The area around it is... well. Cursed. Terrifyingly so.

69.speaker: Barcus Wroot
69.text: I did hear something interesting, though. There are shades that plague the path to the Towers - shades that fear not steel, but light.

68.speaker: Barcus Wroot
68.text: Duergar who mentioned it sounded truly traumatised. It was almost amusing.

85.speaker: Barcus Wroot
85.text: To Baldur's Gate, I expect. I don't know what they plan to do with it, but something of that power turned loose in the city... it could be carnage.

59.speaker: Barcus Wroot
59.text: Wulbren must know their plans. And we must find him.

122.speaker: Player
122.text: This is your business - not mine.

17.speaker: Barcus Wroot
17.text: I don't think you really believe that. A deep gnome strapped to a windmill wasn't your business. A group of captives suffering under mercenaries and cultists wasn't your business.

125.speaker: Barcus Wroot
125.text: You saw people in need, and you helped them. It's what you do, apparently.

79.speaker: Barcus Wroot
79.text: You'll do it again. Won't you?

56.speaker: Player
56.text: The stuff of gnomish myth. Gaerdal Ironhand's private cache of the world's most powerful explosive.

49.speaker: Barcus Wroot
49.text: That myth has come to life.

89.speaker: Player
89.text: The stuff of myth. Gaerdal Ironhand's private cache of the world's most powerful explosive.

77.speaker: Player
77.text: I've heard some rather explosive gnomish myths about it.

28.speaker: Barcus Wroot
28.text: Runepowder. Do you know what it is?

104.speaker: Player
104.text: I have my own matters to attend to.

25.speaker: Barcus Wroot
25.text: I'm certain you do. But... if you should find yourself in the Towers, perhaps you'll keep an eye out for him.

48.speaker: Barcus Wroot
48.text: Meanwhile, I'll need to think of an alternative. I must find Wulbren, especially now that... ahem. Anyway. Wish me luck.

70.speaker: Barcus Wroot
70.text: A great deal. But I wouldn't mind halving the burden.

21.speaker: Barcus Wroot
21.text: Thank you. I think I have a plan. Perhaps I can blast my way in...

101.speaker: Player
101.text: Your friend can likely take care of himself.

78.speaker: Barcus Wroot
78.text: Pah. If only that were true. Wulbren's a good sort, but he wouldn't know his arkayas from his elbow.

91.speaker: Player
91.text: I wouldn't hold out hope for any gnome taken by duergar.

119.speaker: Barcus Wroot
119.text: Nor I. Which means quick action is necessary.

80.speaker: Barcus Wroot
80.text: I'm hesitant to prevail upon you again. But... I can't risk re-capture. I'd be no help to Wulbren at all.

120.speaker: Barcus Wroot
120.text: Would you... would you look for him?

96.speaker: Player
96.text: There's something else I want to discuss.

12.speaker: Player
12.text: Your smokepowder bombs - are you an alchemist?

44.speaker: Barcus Wroot
44.text: Alchemist, tinkerer, adventurer, curmudgeon... I wear many hats, most with great enthusiasm.

115.speaker: Player
115.text: Tell me a little more about yourself.

84.speaker: Barcus Wroot
84.text: Barcus Wroot is my name, Baldur's Gate is my home. Back in the city, I offered my expertise to the highest bidder.

110.speaker: Barcus Wroot
110.text: I was quite popular too - I'm not picky about my customers.

98.speaker: Player
98.text: What can you tell me about the gnomes you were with in the Underdark?

29.speaker: Barcus Wroot
29.text: Ah, the so-called Ironhand Gnomes. Excellent access to technological facilities, but their politics are... dangerous. Increasingly so.

67.speaker: Barcus Wroot
67.text: They've nearly started an all-out war with the Gondians in the House of Wonders in Baldur's Gate. There've been skirmishes, and now I fear...

102.speaker: Barcus Wroot
102.text: Well. There's no point speculating. Let us leave it at 'I fear'.

22.speaker: Player
22.text: What will you do if Wulbren is dead?

31.speaker: Barcus Wroot
31.text: I suppose... I suppose I'd be very, very sad.

1.speaker: Barcus Wroot
1.text: Then, after a while, I'd find whoever killed him and put a smokepowder bomb in their trousers.

36.speaker: Barcus Wroot
36.text: Right. Wulbren's life is at stake. We must focus.

34.speaker: Barcus Wroot
34.text: If you have a moment, I'd like your opinion on something.
